description:
Corynebacterium bouchesdurhonense is a species of bacteria that belongs to the genus Corynebacterium. It is a Gram-positive, non-spore-forming, facultatively anaerobic, and rod-shaped bacterium.

Corynebacterium bouchesdurhonense was first isolated from human clinical samples collected in the Bouches-du-Rh√¥ne region of France. It is a member of the Corynebacterium genus, which is known to include several species that are commonly found as part of the normal human microbiota, particularly in the skin and mucous membranes.

The specific characteristics of Corynebacterium bouchesdurhonense, such as its growth requirements, biochemical properties, and pathogenic potential, are still under investigation. As a recently described species, its ecological roles and potential implications in human health and disease are not yet fully understood.

Further research is needed to elucidate the detailed phenotypic and genomic features of Corynebacterium bouchesdurhonense, as well as its distribution, prevalence, and potential clinical significance.
